Title: AI Experts Reveal #1 Tip for HVAC Contractors Adopting Artificial Intelligence
Summary: Artificial intelligence is no longer a distant concept—it’s already reshaping how contractors do business and how customers search for services. During the Nexstar Network's Super Meeting, technology leaders urged HVACR contractors to think beyond the buzz and focus on building a strong foundation for AI adoption. From optimizing field service management platforms to ensuring clean, accurate data, experts emphasized that success with AI starts with well-documented processes and clear implementation strategies. They also cautioned contractors to consider how their customers are using AI tools like ChatGPT to find HVAC services—and to make sure their businesses are ready to meet those digital demands.

Title: HVAC Excellence Accreditation Strengthens Wisconsin Workforce Development
Summary: MOUNT PROSPECT, Illinois — Northeast Wisconsin Technical College in Green Bay, Wisconsin, has earned programmatic accreditation from HVAC Excellence, confirming that its HVACR program meets the national standards outlined in the HVAC Excellence Accreditation Standards Manual.

Title: Greenheck Launches Fan Energy Index Resource Page for HVAC Professionals
Summary: SCHOFIELD, Wisconsin — Greenheck has introduced an online resource page dedicated to the Fan Energy Index (FEI), a key metric for evaluating fan system efficiency. The page provides HVAC professionals with practical guidance on applying FEI to select fan systems that operate more efficiently, quietly, and reliably.

Title: LG Launches New Program to Boost HVAC Dealer Growth and Training
Summary: ALPHARETTA, Georgia — LG Electronics introduced “Pathway to Platinum,” a new program designed to help HVAC dealers enhance performance, training, and customer relationships through a combination of education, incentives, and business development tools. The initiative was unveiled at the 2025 LG Pro Dealer Summit held in Orlando, Florida.

Title: Mitsubishi Electric Trane HVAC US R-32 VRF Line Meets 2026 Low-GWP Standards
Summary: Mitsubishi Electric Trane HVAC US (METUS) introduced a new line of Variable Refrigerant Flow (VRF) systems using R-32 refrigerant, designed to meet upcoming low-global warming potential (GWP) standards that take effect in January 2026. The systems will be available in select markets beginning in early 2026.

Title: Daikin Applied Launches Global Data Center Solutions Group for Mission-Critical Cooling
Summary: The Magnitude WME-C Quad Chiller features a capacity range of 2,000 to 3,000 tons, ultra-low GWP refrigerants, and advanced features like RapidRestore and RideThrough. The WME-C Quad is engineered for maximum uptime and efficiency in mission-critical facilities.

Title: Ruskin XP500 Louver Simplifies Installation with New Flange Frame Design
Summary: The flange-mounted XP500 maintains the same high-performance standards as the original model, offering durable protection in severe weather conditions for applications such as data centers and community safe rooms.

Title: Panasonic WhisperFit DC Fan Adds Bluetooth Speakers for Dual Function Ventilation
Summary: Panasonic introduced the WhisperFit DC with Bluetooth Speakers, a new residential ventilation solution that integrates high-quality audio and humidity control in a single ENERGY STAR-certified unit. The product is designed for contractors and builders seeking efficient, code-compliant ventilation for bathrooms, laundry rooms, and other moisture-prone spaces.
